pageContext.desc: Marked "strictly private," on "drinking the health of the man who will kick Rosewater out of the State."
pageContext.category: Everett D. Graff Collection of Western Americana; U.S. Western Expansion; Letters (Correspondence)

pages.transcription:
Charles S. Gleed.                     Eugene F. Ware.         James Willis Gleed.          
Law office of Gleed, Ware & Gleed, Topeka, Kansas
D.E. Palmer; Assistant 
Cable Address: “Gleed.”
strictly private
Hon. T. J. Majors.
Omaha, Neb.
Dr. Sir: your favor Sep. 18th at hand.—Of course there is not much left of that poker game after taking out the bottle of Log Cabin. but—the balence, and interest, will all be spent drinking the health of the man who will kick Rosewater out of the state.
Yours very truly
E. F. Ware

pageContext.title: Eugene Fitch Ware letter to T.J. Majors, 1900s
